summary: This is a transcript of a voluntary interview conducted by DOJ OIG Special Agents with a Federal Bureau of Prisons Correctional Systems Officer (S. ) on July 15, 2021. The interview focuses on the officer's knowledge and actions surrounding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein on August 10, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), specifically regarding inmate movements, count procedures, and the removal of Epstein's cellmate, Efrain Reyes, on August 9, 2019.

events.title: Removal of Epstein's Cellmate
events.description: Inmate Efrain Reyes, Jeffrey Epstein's cellmate, was pre-removed from the MCC at 8:38 a.m. to go to court and did not return, leaving Epstein without a cellmate.

events.title: Inmate Fernandez Placed on Dry Cell
events.description: Inmate Fernandez was moved from the SHU to a dry cell in III (Correctional Systems) at 3:15 p.m. He was not properly keyed out of the SHU, leading to count discrepancies.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Inmate Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, an apparent suicide.

events.title: Midnight Count Discrepancy
events.description: During the 12:00 a.m. count on August 10, Lieutenant  discovered a discrepancy: the SHU count slips reported 73 inmates, but there were only 72 physically present because Fernandez had not been keyed out. She corrected the count.

events.title: OIG Interview of BOP Officer
events.description: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducted a voluntary, sworn interview with BOP Correctional Systems Officer S.  regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein and surrounding circumstances.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, NY
Executive Assistant's office (within MCC, where interview was conducted)
keyFacts: Epstein's cellmate, Efrain Reyes, was removed from MCC at 8:38 a.m. on August 9, 2019, and was not expected to return, leaving Epstein without a cellmate.

The witness, who worked in both custody and III, stated that if SHU staff knew Reyes was WAB (With All Belongings) and that Epstein required a cellmate, they should have taken immediate action to assign a new cellmate.

Significant count discrepancies occurred on August 9-10, 2019, because inmate Fernandez was moved to a dry cell but not keyed out of the SHU, causing the SHU to report 73 inmates when only 72 were present.
The witness expressed that communication and training at MCC were poor, with staff often not properly trained and following incorrect practices they observed from others.
The witness believed Epstein took his own life, had no knowledge of anyone assisting him or causing his death, and did not believe cameras were intentionally knocked offline.
